                 co.cask.cdap.proto.ProgramRunStatus status,
                 long timeout,
                 TimeUnit timeoutUnit)
                   throws TimeoutException,
                          InterruptedException
        Description copied from interface: AdapterManager
        Blocks until a specific run of the adapter has the given status.
        Specified by:
        waitForStatus in interface AdapterManager
        Parameters:
        runId - the id of the run to wait for
        status - the status to block for
        timeout - amount of time units to wait
        timeoutUnit - time unit type
        Throws:
        TimeoutException - if timeout reached
        InterruptedException - if execution is interrupted

      • waitForOneRunToFinish

        public void waitForOneRunToFinish(long timeout,
                         TimeUnit timeoutUnit)
                           throws TimeoutException,
                                  InterruptedException
        Description copied from interface: AdapterManager
        Blocks until a one run of the adapter has finished. If a run has already finished this will return right away. This should not be used on a Worker Adapter without calling AdapterManager.stop() first.
        Specified by:
        waitForOneRunToFinish in interface AdapterManager
        Parameters:
        timeout - amount of time units to wait
        timeoutUnit - time unit type
        Throws:
        TimeoutException - if timeout reached
        InterruptedException - if execution is interrupted

      • waitForRunsToFinish

        public void waitForRunsToFinish(int numRuns,
                       long timeout,
                       TimeUnit timeoutUnit)
                         throws TimeoutException,
                                InterruptedException
        Description copied from interface: AdapterManager
        Blocks until the specified number of runs of the adapter has finished. If that many runs have already finished, this will return right away. This should not be used on a Worker Adapter without calling AdapterManager.stop() first.
        Specified by:
        waitForRunsToFinish in interface AdapterManager
        Parameters:
        numRuns - the number of runs to wait to finish.
        timeout - amount of time units to wait
        timeoutUnit - time unit type
        Throws:
        TimeoutException - if timeout reached
        InterruptedException - if execution is interrupted
